definition: abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]
scroll/book/volume/chapter/examination paper/classifier for books, paintings: volume, scroll
to roll up/roll/classifier for small rolled things (wad of paper money, movie reel etc)
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: As the most important painting is of pedantic, but the foundation is still the most important thing.
sentences.chinese: 作畫自然是書卷氣爲重，但是根基還是最要緊的。

sentences.english: that the scholarliness can be first be gained by social learning.
sentences.chinese: 我一向以爲“書卷氣”首先是可以“學而知之”的。

sentences.english: In the other word, it can be shown on people’s face.
sentences.chinese: 換言之“書卷氣”是寫在每個人臉上的。

sentences.english: She seeps her grief to them in the air of scholarly refinementbetween the lines.
sentences.chinese: 她把自己對他們的悲憫滲透在書卷氣的字裏行間。

definition: cultured and refined (idiom); gentle and cultivated
properly/satisfactorily/firmly/very fitting/appropriate/proper/to be in good order/also written 妥帖
to blend into one another/to blend together well
full of political wisdom (idiom)/politically astute/with encyclopedic experience of state policy
